column1: The Gates of Summer was a great feast held in Gondolin when the Gondolindrim sang as the Sun rose.
It was upon the morning of this feast that Morgoths armies attacked Gondolin
In early versions of the Legendarium
column2: more details are provided about the feast: Tarnin Austa (meaning "Gates of Summer" in Gnomish
column3: an older draft of Sindarin) was held on the first day of summer.  It was custom to begin a solemn ceremony at midnight
column4: continuing it until dawn of Tarnin Austa.  No-one could speak from midnight to daybreak
column5: but upon the rising of the Sun they would burst into ancient songs
column6: with choirs standing upon the eastern wall.  At that time the city was filled with silver lamps
column7: and lights of jeweled colors hung on the branches of the new-leaved trees.

column1: In the early 1920s as Tolkien continued to evolve his ideas of Gnomish phonology
column4: he changed the name of the festival to Ternin Awest (or Ennyn Awest) in the Noldorin Word-lists
column5: with the festivals Qenya name being Andonavestan. In his c. 1923 Noldorin Dictionary
column6: Tolkien further emended Ternin to Teirn
column7: reflecting his next conception for pluralizing tarn "gate".
